Senior Research Analyst - Threat Finance
Position Summary
Refinitiv World-Check is seeking a Senior Research Analyst to join our team. We are looking for candidates with a niche background or academic/professional experience in political risk. The candidate should be able to work independently and effectively under pressure to complete quick turnaround assignments. The ability to convey careful analytical judgment and sophisticated information in a concise, impartial, and accessible manner to clients is essential. This is an excellent opportunity for a candidate to work on a diverse and intellectually dynamic team of open source analysts.
Responsibilities
Conduct in-depth investigative research on specific AML/CFT related issues related to South Asia region such as sanctions, organized crime, human trafficking, wildlife trafficking, cybercrime, and related threat finance research” to “Conduct in-depth investigative research on specific AML/CFT related issues related to South Asia and South East Asia region such as sanctions, organized crime, human trafficking, wildlife trafficking, cybercrime, and related threat finance research”.
Analyse a wide range of data sources in local languages to produce daily structured reports and content updates.
Maintain a high level of regional and portfolio country expertise by monitoring breaking news for relevant developments.
Research and extract data from all applicable sources, ensure accuracy and quality of findings by complying with policies and applicable laws.
Provide regular status updates on research projects to research manager.
Effectively collaborate with teams across offices in multiple time zones.
Qualifications
: “Native level proficiency in a South Asian language is required” to “Native level proficiency in a South Asian language or Bahasa Indonesia/Malaysia is required”.
Must possess keen attention to detail, excellent research, writing and analytical skills, and enjoy in-depth investigations to uncover difficult to access information
Knowledge of political and threat finance issues in greater South Asia region.
Understanding of sanctions, law enforcement and regulatory enforcement bodies and relevant national laws concerning the Anti-Money Laundering/Combating the Financing of Terrorism (AML/CFT) regime in South Asia region.
Relevant professional experience including internships, research assistantships, and independent projects that rely on both qualitative and quantitative skills would be preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment
Education/Certifications
Bachelor’s degree preferred in international relations, political science, security studies, history, foreign languages, or other humanities fields. Outstanding recent graduates in other fields or those with proven experience will also be considered.

Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. Job Description:
Job Title : Lead - Business Analyst
The Purpose of This Role
This role is within Customer Solutions Chapter operating in Workplace Investing Agile Model. Lead Business Analyst is responsible for eliciting and capturing story acceptance criteria, developing, and executing business acceptance test plan, test strategy and implementing solutions to address business needs of medium to high complexity.
The Lead Business Analyst is to leverage upon domain knowledge & strong analytical and problem-solving skills. The role requires a person to be highly motivated, “self-starters” with a sense of ownership, and a strong desire to succeed and possess the ability to work individually as well as within a team structure. You will be a key member of the team working closely with a group of cross-functional, multi-disciplinary, and dedicated squad members responsible for delivering specific business goals.
This position is for the Data Exchange Platform (DEX) squad within the Employer Servicing & Integration product area under WI Workplace Platforms domain. The position is for a Lead BA who is 100% dedicated to the DEX squad and work closely with the Computron (DEX DC) and Metroplex (PEPs) squads. This squad manages a platform called as the data exchange platform which is basically a transformation engine for all data feeds we get for employees from clients, payroll vendors and other third parties. This is a product agnostic platform used within WI and have 9+ use cases live in prod on platform. A business analyst would help work with different squads across products to understand the requirements and share with the team to help prioritise the backlog This is going to be a WI common platform to help support DC modernization and would be a critical platform to solve for the single client feed starting next year.
The Value You Deliver
Initiating & Leading Discovery for Feature/Epic Definition & Key Decision Partners with Squad Leader and Scrum Master to prioritize Epics and stories.
Ensuring Epic/Story artifacts (i.e. use cases and supporting documentation) are updated and available for story execution
Writing stories and facilitate story grooming/refinement sessions to ensure stories meet the Definition of Ready
Collaborating effectively with key Business, IT, Legal, Compliance & Risk partners to define product features and monitor trends.
Establishing stakeholder meetings to include demos of sprint deliverables and impact analysis results (User Experience Design, Legal, Outside business groups)
Engaging stakeholders in organizational readiness activities through the lifecycle of the project to proactively mitigate risks related to product delivery.
Communicating issues and stakeholder feedback to the Squad Leader in a clear, concise, and timely manner
Participating and /or facilitating the daily Scrums, Sprint Planning Meetings, Release Planning, Sprint Reviews and Retrospectives
Providing constructive feedback for future process improvements
Identifying business requirements, document improvement opportunities, share with Scrum Team and at BA Forums
Collaborating with the QA team on QA test plan reviews and provides assistance and guidance to QA with story requirements / acceptance criteria clarifications.
Performing End to End Business Acceptance Testing in Acceptance Region and ensure the traceability of test cases to the story acceptance criteria.
Assisting with readiness and deployment activities for each release
The Skills that are Key to this role
Functional / Behavioural
Good listener and having strong verbal communication skills.
Ability to run stakeholder meetings.
Should be able to facilitate a workshop or present a requirement to stakeholder.
Excellent time management skills to ensure that work is completed on time.
Ability to write clear, concise product documentation and communications.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to assimilate new information, draw conclusions and communicate ideas.
Keep up to date on agile best practices and trends Negotiation and influencing skills.
Positive attitude and flexible, with a willingness to adapt to the changing needs of the squad.
Knowledge of US retirement industry
The Skills that are Good to Have for this role
You should have strong Stakeholder management, negotiation and influencing skills, high quality documentation, ability to work independently, strong analytical skills.
Knowledge of Retirement Service Industry domain preferred
The Expertise We’re Looking For
5-6 years of Business Analyst experience
BE, BTech, MBA or bachelor’s degree preferred.
Basic knowledge of business analyst techniques, for example: benchmarking, business rules analysis, risk analysis and user stories, user acceptance testing and product documentation.
Experience with Jira, Confluence, Mural, or similar Agile backlog management tool preferred.
Good understanding on MS Office Suite: Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, and Outlook
CSM/CSPO/BA Certification preferred.
How Your Work Impacts the Organization
Customer Solutions is a group of business professionals who develop and manage end-to-end market leading solutions to deliver increased customer satisfaction and growth.
Our Team comprises of Business Analysts, Consultants, Squad Leaders, and Discipline leaders that operate in agile model, owning end to end responsibility for all aspects of the Product Development Lifecycle process. We support retirement services and healthcare business domains.
We are focused on high quality execution and delivery of technology solutions to drive results and customer outcomes. Our team works collaboratively with IT/QA and other Business teams on key programs and portfolios to deliver maximum business value and ensure timely delivery of capabilities to our customers and set as per domain and tribe’s vision and roadmap.
Location: Chennai
Shift timings: 11:00 am - 8:00pm
Certifications:

Our formula is simple: we support our team, and they support our customers. That culture begins with our employees, whose personal and professional growth is key to our collective success. In keeping with that legacy, our privately-held company offers associates career stability and security, while at the same time encouraging your professional exploration and growth. Job Description
JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY:
The IT Systems Administrator plays a critical role working closely with the business and across the Information Technology organization in maintaining the EHS platform from user access and security perspective. This position will also be responsible for acting as a subject matter expert in triaging and handling Level 1 support to customers. Managing and resolving incidents and tickets will be the responsibility of this person.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
The Systems Administrator will maintain the system, user access, and security on the EHS platform. Managing roles and responsibilities, authentication, as well as data security will be the key responsibility of this role.
This role will also serve as first-level help desk for end users of Ideagen. (Position could potentially support current platform, Intelex, until it is sunset and Ideagen goes live.) The System Administrator will investigate and address user issues (resolve issues, escalate to vendor support, or work with the Systems Analyst to log enhancement requests).
The systems administrator will also support both internal and external systems that integrate with Ideagen. These integrations will be implemented using varying technologies. If (when) issues or failures occur in feeds, the systems administrators will identify if the issue was data-related or technology-related. s/he will work on the resolution.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Serve as the systems administrator supporting users access and authorization on the EHS platform.
Act as subject matter expert on integrations between the various systems that form the EHS portfolio.
Provide Level I support for any incidents or tickets raised by users and triage or resolve these issues in-house or log these on the vendor incident management platform.
Manage support SLA’s with the vendor and run metrics and reports to monitor the levels of support provided by the vendor.
Serve as a strong consultative partner to EHS Business Partners and EHS COEs in service delivery.
Manage EHS Master Data Management and data stewardship role for all incoming and outgoing data between the various systems in the EHS footprint.
Work to meet expected business performance goals by providing full range of customer service.
Participate in scheduled and ad hoc training to improve policy and process acumen.
Other projects and duties may be required by business needs and requirements.
ADDITIONAL PREFERRED ATTRIBUTES
EHS industry experience or certifications is a huge plus.
Expertise in systems administration on SaaS platforms is a must.
Experience in access management and authorization of users to the systems is required.
Handling PII data and maintaining data security is a key requirement of this role.
Functional experience in configurations, enhancements, and good understanding of environment, health, and safety business practices required.
Effective vendor management is a significant part of this job.
Understanding of integrations between EHS incident management and claims processing systems is required.
Knowledge of OSHA requirements and policies is required.
Strong verbal and written communication skills to interact with business partners.
Ability to accurately collect information to understand and assess the stakeholder’s needs and situation.
Strong attention to detail
Ability to prioritize workload and provide timely follow-up and resolution.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects.
REQUIRED SKILLS:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
Working knowledge on Ideagen or similar EHS incident management tools highly desirable
5+ years of experience administering EHS platforms

Job Title: TULIP Support Analyst
Career Level - C2
Introduction to Role:
Join a team with the backing and investment to win! As a TULIP Sr.Support Analyst, you will ensure optimum performance and stability for multiple systems for the Manufacturing Systems capability for AstraZeneca Operations. You will provide 2nd/ 3rd line support, take ownership of issues, support development activities, and develop specialist knowledge in relevant systems. You will also liaise with multiple stakeholders and train, guide, and mentor new hires in the team.
Accountabilities:
Your role will involve ensuring the smooth running of our IT systems, providing technical support, and identifying areas for improvement. You will be responsible for code build and deployment, tool configuration management and administration, application environment set up, change and release management. You will also be expected to develop specialist knowledge in relevant systems and share that knowledge with global teams.
Essential Skills/Experience:
2-3 years of prior experience in application support and maintenance (L2/L3 support)
Strong in database (Oracle /SQL) querying and writing stored procedures
Development and troubleshooting experience on web applications built on the Microsoft .NET framework (ASP, VB, C#)
Good understanding of Microsoft IIS/Web Services (IIS 6.0, IIS 5.0)
Experience working with tools like Microsoft Visual Source Safe, Microsoft Visual Interdev, Microsoft Visual Studio, SQL Developer, Toad
Experience on Windows/UNIX application environment and understanding of client-server / distributed computing concepts
Basic understanding of session virtualization concepts, exposure to Citrix working environments
Understanding of incident, problem, change and release management process
Demonstrated ability to apply technical knowledge to multiple systems and support multiple business groups.
Desirable Skills/Experience:
Familiarity with life sciences(Pharma) domain concepts, workflow and terminology
Experience with providing technical support to scientific applications/software in Manufacturing Execution Systems
Development and troubleshooting experience with MS SQL Server (2008, 2005, 2000)
Experience in setting up and managing application environments
Mindset to support business critical applications

Industry analysts are critical stakeholders for Cognizant, providing unique market knowledge and message development support that leads to improved brand amplification and lead generation.
As a Analyst Relations manager will develop and execute of a strategic program for analyst engagement for the designated Business unit.
Cognizant is seeking an experienced, independent, organized, and sharp Analyst Relations manager to support key program initiatives to:
Achieve specific AR operational outcomes.
Drive ongoing improvement in the AR processes.
Custodian of critical AR artefacts and knowledge management.

Meeting specific AR program targets around retention of leadership placement and improving placement in RFI reports
Other activites include:
Own the research calendar, across all business units and analyst firms for mapping the annual AR agenda.

Excellent project management, communication, writing skills and strong attention to detail.

Energetic and enthusiastic with a team player mindset.

Job Description:
At bp, we’re reimagining energy for people and our planet. We have a bold ambition be a net zero company by 2050 or sooner, and help the world get to net zero. Crafting a more efficient business that makes the best use of its resources is a critical part of getting there. And that’s what our new global business services (GBS) centre in Pune, India is here to do – put digital at the heart of our business and accelerate the transformation of bp’s business processes across the globe. Driven by the bp values and comprising capabilities in data, procurement, finance, and customer service, the GBS centre will drive innovative digital solutions and agile ways of working.

ROLE SYNOPSIS:
This role will focus on building the Analytics Strategy and execution plan for GBS. It focuses on crafting actionable insights for various global business lines in a balanced manner. This will be part of Analytics COE that sets analytics governance for rest of the organization.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Data Analysis and Interpretation:
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business decisions.
Develop and maintain data models to support business intelligence and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization:
Build insightful and visually appealing reports and dashboards using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or SAP Analytics Cloud.
Present data-driven insights to key partners and provide actionable recommendations.
SAP Process Knowledge:
Demonstrate a deep understanding of SAP processes, modules, and data structures.
Collaborate with SAP teams to optimize data extraction, transformation, and loading processes.
Data Quality Assurance:
Implement data quality standards and best practices to maintain data integrity.
Identify and resolve data quality issues, ensuring high-quality data for analysis.
Automation and Efficiency:
Automate data collection and reporting processes where possible to improve efficiency.
Stay updated on industry best practices and new technologies related to data analysis and SAP.
Collaboration:
Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and provide data-driven solutions.
Collaborate with IT teams to ensure data availability and accessibility.
CRUCIAL EXPERIENCE AND JOB REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, such as Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Eagerness to learn and a strong curiosity about data analytics and SAP processes.
Basic knowledge of data analysis tools, such as Excel, SQL, or basic scripting languages.
Superb interpersonal skills and the ability to work optimally in a team.
Ability to adapt to a multifaceted and fast-paced work environment

DESIRABLE CRITERIA:
Familiarity with SAP or previous exposure to SAP systems.
Basic knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Internship or coursework related to data analysis

Travel Requirement
Negligible travel should be expected with this role

Relocation Assistance:
This role is eligible for relocation within country

Remote Type:
This position is a hybrid of office/remote working

Skills:
Accounting for financial instruments, Accounting for financial instruments, Accounting policy, Accounting processes and financial systems, Agility core practices, Agility tools, Analytical Thinking, Analytics, Business Intelligence (BI), Business process control, Business process improvement, Collaboration, Commercial acumen, Commercial assurance for external reporting, Communication, Creativity and Innovation, Credit Management, Curiosity, Customer centric thinking, Data Analysis, Data Visualization, Data visualization and interpretation, Decision Making, Digital Automation, Digital fluency {+ 7 more}

Job Description:
We are looking for a skilled HR manager to oversee all aspects of Human Resources practices and processes. You will support business needs and ensure the proper implementation of company strategy and objectives. The goal is to promote corporate values and enable business success through human resources management, including job design, recruitment, performance management, training & development, employment cycle changes, talent management, and facilities management services.
Responsibilities:
Enhances the organization's human resources by planning, implementing, and evaluating employee relations and human resources policies, programs, and practices.
Maintains the work structure by updating job requirements and job descriptions for all positions.
Supports organization staff by establishing and interviewing program; counselling managers on candidate selection; conducting and analyzing exit interviews; and recommending changes.
Prepares employees for assignments by establishing and conducting orientation and training programs.
Manages a pay plan by conducting periodic pay surveys; scheduling and conducting job evaluations; preparing pay budgets; monitoring and scheduling individual pay actions; and recommending, planning, and implementing pay structure revisions.
Ensures planning, monitoring, and appraisal of employee work results by training managers to coach and discipline employees; scheduling management conferences with employees; hearing and resolving employee grievances; and counselling employees and supervisors.
Implements employee benefits programs and informs employees of benefits by studying and assessing benefit needs and trends; recommending benefit programs to management; directing the processing of benefit claims; obtaining and evaluating benefit contract bids; awarding benefit contracts; and designing and conducting educational programs on benefit programs.
Ensures legal compliance by monitoring and implementing applicable human resource federal and state requirements, conducting investigations, maintaining records, and representing the organization at hearings.

Main Purpose:
Responsible for the setup and administration of master data in multiple IT systems by adhering to processes and controls to ensure master data quality and develop and support the data policies, rules and standards for their respective master data domain across the enterprise.
 Monitor, report and drive SLA & KPI’s for the specific Master Data domain
Knowledge Skills and Abilities, Key Responsibilities:
Key Responsibilities
Help create new & improved processes for customer/supplier master data management
Ensure master data objects are controlled & setup, created as per policies defined
Manage data policy & processes maps for the associated master data object
Act as a SME for a domain’s master data related questions and coordinate with IT and Business for the various system implementations
Partner with the Data Officer to implement rules, policies and controls to ensure master data is complete, consistent and accurate
Design Data quality issues to identify areas for data quality improvement and execute action plans to resolve issues
Implement process controls & improvements for prevention of data quality issues and integrity across key systems
Follow up with data owners/users to remediate data issues in order to maintain the agreed levels of quality
Daily capturing, uploading and controlling of data files from trading systems into accounting system ledgers
Performing system integrity checks, correcting errors immediately where possible or managing the issue with IT and business teams
Partner with the Data Officer to implement rules, policies and controls to ensure master data is complete, consistent and accurate
Help design and manage Master data workflows to improve processes.

.

Position Summary:
The Human Resources Data Analyst II is based in Coimbatore and responsible for providing the Talent Acquisition Center of Excellence support to all areas of our team’s operations. This includes collaborating with Regional TA leaders, Recruiters, and Coordinators to ensure they have the necessary resources and tools to be successful. Reporting to the Global Talent Acquisition Operations Leader and collaborating with the Global Shared Services Center, this role is primarily focused on data, reporting and analytics to provide our team with valuable insights to make data driven decisions.


Work You’ll Do:
Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, and spotting patterns and trends within this data.
Help to develop, lead, and influence an increase in data driven decisions across the Talent Acquisition team, leading to increased efficiency, productivity, and automation.
Assist in analyzing and assessing capacity, productivity and performance trends of Recruiters, Coordinators, and Hiring Managers to identify opportunities for continuous improvement and development.
Assist and help lead Talent Acquisition projects focused on technology, systems, and processes to improve productivity and efficiency of the team.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Basic Qualifications:
A bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or a related field.
2-4 years of experience as a data analyst or business data analyst.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases, and programming.
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to present complex information in an understandable and compelling manner.
Who we are:
Milacron is a global leader in the manufacture, distribution and service of highly engineered and customized systems within the $27 billion plastic technology and processing industry. We are the only global company with a full-line product portfolio that includes hot runner systems, injection molding, extrusion equipment. We maintain strong market positions across these products, as well as leading positions in process control systems, mold bases and components, maintenance, repair and operating (“MRO”) supplies for plastic processing equipment. Our strategy is to deliver highly customized equipment, components and service to our customers throughout the lifecycle of their plastic processing technology systems. Milacron is a Operating Company of Hillenbrand.

Hillenbrand (NYSE: HI) is a global industrial company that provides highly-engineered, mission-critical processing equipment and solutions to customers in over 100 countries around the world. Our portfolio is composed of leading industrial brands that serve large, attractive end markets, including durable plastics, food, and recycling. Guided by our Purpose — Shape What Matters For Tomorrow™ — we pursue excellence, collaboration, and innovation to consistently shape solutions that best serve our associates, customers, communities, and other stakeholders. To learn more, visit: www.Hillenbrand.com.

Position Overview:

The Data Insights Analyst occupies a central role within the Data Analytics and Quantitative Research team. Specializing in harnessing advanced analytics and AI-driven techniques, this role is committed to unearthing sophisticated insights from intricate data sets. The Analyst will focus on both interpreting these findings and constructing analytical solutions tailored to the needs of stakeholders in the Legal Insurance business.

Key Responsibilities:

Advanced Data Analysis:
Utilize state-of-the-art analytics techniques to dissect data, identifying patterns, trends, and anomalies.
Leverage machine learning algorithms to predict outcomes and detect anomalies.

AI-Driven Insights:
Implement cutting-edge AI techniques to enhance data interpretation capabilities.
Continually explore and integrate new AI methods to remain at the forefront of data insights innovation.

Data Visualization:
Design and create dynamic dashboards and reports to communicate findings in a comprehensible format to various stakeholders.
Utilize tools like Power BI or similar platforms for effective data representation.

Analytical Solution Construction:
Engage with legal insurance stakeholders to understand their unique challenges and requirements.
Architect and implement bespoke analytical solutions that address these needs, driving data-informed decisions.

Communication of Insights:
Collaborate closely with business units to discern their data necessities and provide tailored recommendations based on in-depth analysis.
Articulate findings and insights to senior management, ensuring clarity and actionable takeaways.

Collaborative Research:
Partner with members of the Quantitative Research team on joint studies and research initiatives.
Pursue collaborative research opportunities with external partners or academic institutions.

Data Management and Quality Assurance:
Uphold the integrity, accuracy, and consistency of all data sources.
Institute and maintain data quality metrics, ensuring data reliability.

Stay Updated and Innovate:
Remain abreast of industry advancements, tools, and techniques in data analytics, machine learning, and AI.
Introduce and embed novel methods to elevate the analytical prowess of the team.

Qualifications:
Proficiency in statistical analysis tools like R or Python.
Familiarity with advanced analytics techniques and machine learning algorithms.
Proven experience in data analytics, preferably within the legal insurance or a related sector.
Strong problem-solving acumen and meticulous attention to detail.
Exceptional communication aptitude, both written and verbal.
Ability to thrive both independently and collaboratively.

Job Title: S/4HANA IT Business Analyst
Career Level - E
Introduction to role:
Are you ready to redefine the Global template for AstraZeneca? As a S/4HANA IT Business Analyst, you will be a key player in our ambitious journey towards standardization. You will be part of a wider SAP S/4HANA IT design team, focusing on defining the IT and data solution that supports our global standardized business process. This role is specifically aligned with our Global Supply operations capability.
Accountabilities:
Your responsibilities will span from designing the IT solution that underpins the global standard process design for your capability, supporting the business teams in the process design to ensure alignment with SAP standard functionality, to working with other members of S/4HANA solution design team to ensure that the wider S/4HANA solution is effectively and robustly integrated across all SET areas. You will also stay aware of the evolution of S/4HANA functionalities and bring that information to the project to inform both current and future design.
Essential Skills/Experience:
SAP implementations for complex global organisations from design to completion
Experience of Pharmaceutical supply chain business activities and the required business outcomes within the relevant capability area
Knowledge of SAP technologies and functionalities including APO
Good stakeholder management and communication skills with Business and IT areas
Strong team player able to work across the program team and communicate in business and IT terms
Comfortable with ambiguity and possessing an agile and open mindset
Self-motivated with the ability to prioritise effectively to ensure project goals are achieved.
Strong skills in business operations, communications, customer and partner engagement, and internal stakeholder management
Confident to challenge the status quo and facilitate different perspectives to drive solutions
Able to manage large work efforts and meet challenging deadlines
Demonstrated personal credibility and positive energy
Able to think out of the box, thrive in ambiguous and stressful situations
Innovative capabilities, agile mindset requiring strategic thinking and foresight.
Desirable Skills/Experience:
Certification in specific SAP S/4HANA or ECC lines of business or willingness to complete such certification
A track record of delivering SAP configuration designs for supply chain modules
Worked in a hybrid environment with a mix of internal and external resources in multiple geographical locations
Knowledge of non-SAP technologies in the relevant line of business eg OMP

But that doesn't mean we’re not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.

At AstraZeneca, we dare to disrupt an industry and change lives. Our work has a direct impact on patients, transforming our ability to develop life-changing medicines. We empower the business to perform at its peak and lead a new way of working, combining cutting-edge science with leading digital technology platforms and data. Ready to make a meaningful impact? Apply now and join us in our journey to disrupt an industry and change lives!

Job Summary:

As a Financial Analyst specializing in Personal Equity Portfolio, you will play a key role in researching, analyzing, and maintaining a diverse portfolio of personal equity investments. Your primary responsibility will be to provide valuable insights and recommendations to optimize the performance and growth of the portfolio. This role requires a strong understanding of financial markets, investment strategies, and the ability to leverage analytical tools to make informed decisions.

Hourly rate in USD: $4.50
Shift Schedule: 10 am to 6 pm. India time.

Key Responsibilities:
Portfolio Analysis:
Conduct thorough research and analysis of personal equity investments to assess their financial health, growth potential, and risk factors.
Monitor market trends, economic indicators, and industry developments to stay informed about factors influencing the portfolio.
Performance Reporting:
Prepare regular reports on the performance of the personal equity portfolio, highlighting key metrics and trends.
Communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, providing insights and recommendations for decision-making.
Due Diligence:
Conduct due diligence on potential investment opportunities, including financial statement analysis, valuation, and assessment of management capabilities.
Collaborate with investment teams and external partners to gather relevant information and insights.
Quarterly Data entry:
Track quarterly reports and make appropriate data entries to our Stock Performance monitoring sheets.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field (Master's degree or CFA designation is a plus).
Proven experience as a Financial Analyst or in a similar role with a focus on personal equity investments.
Strong proficiency in data analysis, and investment research.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
Requirements:
3+ years of experience in the financial industry.
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills in English (C1 Level).
Must have a laptop/desktop which meets the minimum qualifications:
Processor:
Core i5 or higher
RAM - 8GB or higher
Bandwidth Requirements Minimum:
Download Speed: at least 6 Mbps
Upload Speed: at least 6 Mbps
A quiet, private place in your home where you can work without background
Benefits:
Work from home
Access to diverse projects
Opportunities for professional growth
Collaboration with diverse teams
No commute time

Eco-friendly work lifestyle

Our Story So Far
Twelve years back, Lenskart was started by a 26-year old entrepreneur - because he wanted to solve the problem of preventive blindness. We had humble beginnings - we spread awareness about eyecare, we took orders for eyeglasses online and shipped them to customers from a warehouse that was the size of a modern-day conference room.
As of today, little by little, Lenskart has served 40 Million people across the globe - helping them see better and lead better quality lives. Simultaneously, we’ve also built ourselves up to be Asia’s largest eyewear company. We have 10,000+ Lenskartians worldwide, more than 1500 Omni channel stores across 175 cities in India, Singapore and Dubai and cut to 2022 - we are shipping a pair of eyewear every 2.5 seconds, from the world’s most automated eyewear factory!
In 2022, Lenskart partnered with Owndays and took a majority stake in the Japanese-owned eyewear player that has a deep presence in Asia. With this partnership, we have added an additional 400 stores and extended our reach to 13 countries.

Our Key Investors
Softbank, ADIA, Kedaara Capital, Steadview Capital, Premji Invest, Temasek, Holding, KKR, Alpha Wave Ventures, Bay Capital.

You: In Our Next Chapter
We've come a long way but we're not there yet.
"Good is not good enough," you'll hear Lenskartians say that often. Our aim is to serve One Billion eyes by 2025 globally. And in this journey, we want to go beyond vision correction to transform the way people see and experience the world. That’s our new purpose - and we can only get there through cutting-edge technology and exceptional people.

Role Summary
A Procurement Analyst plays a crucial role in the efficient functioning of an organization's procurement process. This professional is responsible for analysing and optimizing the procurement lifecycle, from identifying potential suppliers to managing contracts and ensuring cost-effectiveness. The role requires a keen understanding of market trends, negotiation skills, and the ability to collaborate with various stakeholders.
Key Responsibilities:
Market Research and Supplier Evaluation:
Conduct thorough market research to identify potential suppliers and vendors.
Evaluate and analyse supplier capabilities, pricing, and performance.
Maintain a database of qualified suppliers and their product/service offerings.
Cost Analysis and Negotiation: Analyse pricing proposals, terms, and conditions from suppliers.
Negotiate contracts and agreements to secure favourable terms for the organization.
Identify cost-saving opportunities and implement strategies to optimize procurement expenses.
Contract Management:
Develop and manage contracts with suppliers, ensuring compliance with organizational policies and legal requirements.
Monitor contract performance and address any issues or discrepancies.
Collaborate with legal and finance teams to ensure contracts are comprehensive and legally sound.
Data Analysis and Reporting:
Utilize analytical tools to assess procurement data and performance metrics.
Generate reports on key performance indicators (KPIs) for management review.
Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to enhance procurement processes.
Stakeholder Collaboration:
Collaborate with various departments, including finance, operations, and project management, to understand their procurement needs.
Communicate with internal stakeholders to gather requirements and provide procurement-related guidance.
Risk Management:
Identify and assess potential risks in the procurement process.
Develop strategies to mitigate risks and ensure continuity of the supply chain.
Stay informed about industry regulations and compliance requirements.
Key Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in business, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Procurement Analyst or in a similar role.
Strong analytical and negotiation skills.
Familiarity with procurement software and data analysis tools.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Knowledge of legal and regulatory requirements related to procurement.
We assure you
A friendly culture where you are encouraged to share ideas and opinions.
A journey that will challenge and reward you in multiple ways.

Advanced proficiency in MS Excel, Bloomberg, and other relevant financial analysis tools.
Strong written and verbal communication skills for presenting complex financial information effectively.
Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

About The/Nudge:
The/Nudge is an action institute working towards a poverty-free India, within our lifetime. We partner with governments, markets, and civil society to build resilient livelihoods for all. We are a collective of some of India’s best leaders and entrepreneurs from across the industry, academia, government, and development sectors

About the Program
The Asha Kiran program aims to catalyze impact at scale by partnering with private sector and government, to implement livelihood interventions for women in poor households.

Who are we solving for?
women farmers from landless, marginal, and small landholders
with an average family size of 5-6 members
who have unpredictable wage labor
male members migrate for livelihood opportunities
These farmers need a diversified & sustainable income to withstand life shocks, as well as to improve their food & income security, asset value & savings, and access to safety nets and financial instruments, so as to come out of poverty.

What are we solving for?
Farmers in India have experienced newer opportunities through livestock-based livelihood models promoted by govt/ markets, but there’s a need to build sustainable pro-poor models at population scale. While we are implementing livestock promotion models (backyard poultry and goatery models) in Uttar Pradesh, we also recognize and work towards building a deeper understanding of the value chain to create incentives for markets to participate & leverage govt resources to solve for:
Infrastructure (Land & assets, Information & Technology)
Standardization of rearing practices
Forward & backward linkages for farmers
Collectivisation of efforts through community institutions (SHGs)
Organized production

At The/Nudge you will:
be an integral member of the Asha Kiran team through a deep understanding of the practitioners’ perspective rather than an academic point of view
conduct data analysis and evidence-based decision-making
support the team in collecting and analyzing data; providing time-to-time feedback to the team, organization as well as partners. The focus will be a deep understanding of the outcomes to generate insights to help refine/enhance the work on the ground
supervise/conduct qualitative and quantitative primary and secondary research by working closely with the product, implementation, and L&D team.
create and periodically enhance quality core (macroeconomic, demographic) data depository that helps form the basis for program design and impact assessment for programs focused on livelihoods, rural development, etc.
Support team in setting running monitoring and evaluation processes using different tools and techniques with a focus on the use of ICT.
Apply if you have:
a master’s or bachelor’s degree
at least 3 years of experience in the corporate or development sector
strong analytical and synthesis skills; experience in collecting and processing large raw datasets to provide a basis for quality analysis
working experience and expertise with data analysis applications: Power BI, Tableau, GSuites, Excel etc
strong communication skills and a proven record of working well in teams
comfort with non-profit sector salaries
willingness to travel extensively on the field
have a strong desire to make a difference and a passion for solving hard problems
enjoy the challenge of working in a fast-paced, start-up environment
Would be great if you have:
Experience and working with data frameworks from international development organizations.

We aspire to be an inclusive and diverse organization and encourage qualified individuals irrespective of their religion, caste, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity, age, or any other dimension of identity, to apply.

If you are a self-starter, someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, with a passion for building scalable long-term solutions, then you are the right candidate for our team. In this role, the candidate would work closely with tech teams and product/program across US, EU and JP to build scalable solutions and drive WBRs for your domain.

The position is based in Bangalore. We seek a quick-learner who can quickly familiarize themselves with a fast-paced environment, build relationships with cross-functional teams, and assume ownership for a broad array of domains. Our team culture is goal-oriented, collaborative and driven to achieve results.

Key job responsibilities
Analyze and visualize data to generate insights for business and report with recommendation.
Present recommendations to business leaders and drive decisions. Also manage implementation of those recommendations.
Develop and recommend metrics that supports Business and Product growth.
Drive WBRs for your domain.
Serve as liaison between the Business and technical teams to achieve the goal of providing actionable insights into current business performance, and ad hoc investigations into future improvements or innovations. This will require data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Bengaluru, KA, IND

Experience in data mining, ETL, etc. and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets
Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab

As an Inventory Analyst, your primary responsibility is to monitor and optimize inventory levels to ensure efficient supply chain operations. You will analyze inventory data, forecast demand, and implement strategies to minimize stockouts and excess inventory. Additionally, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve inventory management processes and drive cost savings.
Responsibilities:
Inventory Analysis and Planning:
Analyze historical sales data, market trends, and customer demand to forecast future inventory needs.
Monitor inventory levels, identifying discrepancies, and taking corrective actions to maintain accuracy.
Optimize inventory levels by setting appropriate reorder points, safety stock levels, and lead times.
Conduct regular inventory audits and cycle counts to ensure data accuracy and minimize discrepancies.
Demand Forecasting:
Collaborate with sales, marketing, and operations teams to gather demand forecasts and align inventory accordingly.
Utilize statistical models, forecasting tools, and market insights to accurately predict demand.
Analyze demand patterns, seasonality, and sales trends to adjust inventory planning strategies.
Inventory Optimization:
Identify slow-moving or obsolete inventory and recommend actions to minimize holding costs and improve cash flow.
Evaluate suppliers' performance and lead time to ensure timely replenishment of inventory.
Implement inventory control and management strategies such as ABC analysis, just-in-time (JIT), or economic order quantity (EOQ) to optimize inventory levels.
Reporting and Communication:
Generate regular reports and key performance indicators (KPIs) related to inventory performance.
Communicate inventory status, trends, and recommendations to stakeholders and management.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as purchasing, logistics, and finance, to align inventory strategies with overall business objectives.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or a related field.
Proven experience of 7+ years as an Inventory Analyst or in a similar role, preferably in a fast-paced environment.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and draw actionable insights.
Proficiency in inventory management software and enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems.
Knowledge of demand forecasting techniques and inventory optimization strategies.
Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey complex information to various stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.

titles: Business Intelligence Engineer I, FinOps FP&A
descriptions:
4+ years of experience as an analyst or engineer in the data/BI space
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quick sight, or similar tools
Experience with SQL
Retrieve and analyze data using SQL, Excel, and other data management systems
About the Organization: Amazon is a US-based multinational electronic commerce company headquartered in Seattle, Washington. Amazon.com started as an online bookstore, but soon diversified into many other categories, with a vision to be earth's most customer-centric company & to build a place where people can come to find and discover anything they might want to buy online.

About the role: Amazon's Finance Operations, Accounting & Analysis (FOAA) team is a fast-paced, team-focused, dynamic environment and delivering great experiences for our customers is top priority. FOAA is seeking a Business Intelligence Engineer to support our Amazon Music team.
As an Amazon Business Intelligence Engineer you will be working in one of the world's largest and most complex data warehouse environments. You should have deep experience in the design, creation, management, and business use of large datasets. You should have excellent business and communication skills to be able to work with business owners to develop and define key business questions, and to build data sets that answer those questions. You should be good at designing, implementing, and operating stable, scalable, low cost solutions to flow data from production systems into the data warehouse and into end-user facing applications. You should be able to work with business customers in understanding the business requirements and implementing reporting solutions.
The person will need to effectively communicate across all levels and be self-motivated to raise the bar on deriving insights from analytics and identify opportunities to delight the customers. Above all you should be passionate about bringing large datasets together to answer business questions and drive change.

This person will own the production and delivery of suite of analytics reports and dashboards used by the organization to make key business decisions. This will involve:
1) Delivery of standardized performance metrics for global customers (Vendors) and stakeholders (Amazon Music) providing operational bandwidth to Amazon music teams to focus on business partnering initiatives.
2) Partner with existing BI leader in executing defined roadmap of projects.
3) Provide ad-hoc support to Amazon music finance and business services for SQL report creation, modification and optimization.
4) Debug report issues, unblock workflows and communicate with other teams and stakeholders by providing regular status updates.

Tools used include:
1. SQL (Oracle and Redshift)
2. ETL tools (internal)
3. Excel
4. Tableau
5. Report scheduling tools (internal)

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Bangalore, KA, IND | Bengaluru, KA, IND

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or related fields
Experience in Microsoft Excel
Ability to work in a fast-paced and rapidly-changing environment with experience managing multiple priorities and projects
Excellent written, verbal, listening and communication skills
Experience with reporting tools like Tableau or other BI packages
Team player - FP&A experience to develop forecasting models, and report variance against goals will be an added advantage

titles: REF25217Q-Deputy Manager - MIS (Power BI, Dashboard, Excel) - GGN
descriptions:
Company Description

WNS (Holdings) Limited (NYSE: WNS), is a leading Business Process Management (BPM) company. We combine our deep industry knowledge with technology and analytics expertise to co-create innovative, digital-led transformational solutions with clients across 10 industries. We enable businesses in Travel, Insurance, Banking and Financial Services, Manufacturing, Retail and Consumer Packaged Goods, Shipping and Logistics, Healthcare, and Utilities to re-imagine their digital future and transform their outcomes with operational excellence.We deliver an entire spectrum of BPM services in finance and accounting, procurement, customer interaction services and human resources leveraging collaborative models that are tailored to address the unique business challenges of each client. We co-create and execute the future vision of 400+ clients with the help of our 44,000+ employees. Our global footprint spans 16 countries with 61 delivery centers worldwide including in China, Costa Rica, India, the Philippines, Poland, Romania, South Africa, Spain, Sri Lanka, Turkey, United Kingdom and the United States.

Job Description

MIS – Advanced Excel, Power BI Resource will be responsible for the overall design & deployment of Dashboard and its effective implementation.
The individual will understand business problems, and create solutions to address them leveraging multiple Platform and other data sources.
The individual is also responsible for effectively delivering the results to the relevant stakeholders.
Roles & Responsibilities -
Understand business requirements in Business context and design data models to transform raw data into meaningful insights.
Create dashboards and interactive visual reports using BI Tools etc.
Identify key performance indicators (KPIs) with clear objectives and consistently monitoring.
Analyzing data and present data through reports that aid decision-making.
Convert business requirements into technical specifications and decide timeline to accomplish.
Create relationships between data and develop tabular and other multidimensional data models

Design, develop, test, and deploy scripts and perform detailed analytics
Perform queries and functions in both Power BI & Tableau
Analyze current ETL process, define and design new systems
Redefine and make technical/strategic changes to enhance existing Business Intelligence systems
Create customize charts and custom calculations as per requirements
Design, develop and deploy business intelligence solutions as per needs
SQL querying for best results, use of filters and graphs for better understanding of data
Work with users and team members at all level for performance improvement and suggestions

Skills required:
At least 6-9 years of experience using BI Tool in developing and publishing dashboards
Integrating with different data-sources such as relational/non-relational databases, One drive, Cloud components etc.
Familiar with a wide variety of standard and community-sourced chart types
Utilizing best practices to ensure optimized Data Models

4. Power Automate
5. AZURE

Comfortable with rotational shift.

The opportunity
EY is looking for Senior Consultant/Consultant Analytics with expertise in Anaplan.

About Lowe’s
Lowe's Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company serving approximately 17 million customer transactions a week in the U.S. With total fiscal year 2022 sales of over $97 billion, approximately $92 billion of sales were generated in the U.S., where Lowe's operates over 1,700 home improvement stores and employs approximately 300,000 associates. Based in Mooresville, N.C., Lowe's supports the communities it serves through programs focused on creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts.
About Lowe’s India: At Lowe's India, we are the enablers who help create an engaging customer experience for our $97 billion home improvement business at Lowe's. Our 4000+ associates work across technology, analytics, business operations, finance & accounting, product management, and shared services. We leverage new technologies and find innovative methods to ensure that Lowe's has a competitive edge in the market.
About the Team
The Collateral team is responsible for end-to-end life cycle management of in-store Non-Retail Items (NRIs) such as Graphics & Signage, Fixtures, Displays, etc. A collateral is any non-retail item which is used for the support or promotion of retail products but not for sale itself. Examples: Bay fixtures, Free-standing gondolas, Cash registers, Christmas decal, etc. The reporting team provides insights and analysis to internal and external stakeholders to help streamlining process and make business decisions.
Core Responsibilities:
Identify data sources & streamline data pulls to be utilized Collateral Dashboard. Further, build & maintain weekly, quarterly, and seasonal reporting, dashboards and scorecards.
Deliver execution along with reporting within prescribed timelines with expected level of quality.
Collaborate with local & global partners on regular basis to understand Business Area related processes/updates and bring back learnings to the team. In addition, solve for any function or Business Area related issues or discrepancies.
Lead complex projects, while owning the transition of new process capabilities and reporting requirements.
As a functional SME, identify and drive process improvements & automation efforts by partnering with Product & Technology team. In addition, proactively provide insightful information like a thought leader.
Monitor process audits and partner with the team on implementing preventive & corrective action items.
Work with Collateral Production team to identity automation and streamline opportunities for the processes help in standardize the same.
Work in a team environment with focus on achieving team goals vs individual goals by owning & implementing best practices.
Act as a mentor for the new hires within the team, help in build strong Business and Functional context alongside reporting expertise.
Collaborate with internal teams and global stakeholders to identify enhancement opportunities for the existing reports and scope for advancement.
Create, amend and review SOPs and process maps for all reports.
Years of Experience:
5-6 years of Retail Experience
Education Qualification & Certifications (optional)
Required Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree with 5-6 years of relevant experience
Master’s degree in data Analytics / Retail / Operations Management with 4+ years of relevant experience
Skill Set Required
Primary Skills (must have)
Experience in Data mining and visualization tool such as PoweBI, Excel, SQL and Knime / Alteryx,
Experience working with Power App & Power Automate
Project Management (Intermediate)
Experience / understanding of Retail Industry (local or global)
Strong communication skills – ability to comprehend, articulate and seamlessly communicate locally and globally
Process Improvement / Automation experience
Problem Solving – ability to leverage data, information, and visuals to solve business and execution challenges. Identify ways of improving process
Experience working in Global Operating Model
Secondary Skills (desired)
Python

Lowe's is an equal opportunity employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law.

Company Description

Company Overview
Third Bridge is a market-leading investment research firm. We provide integrated solutions for the world’s top investors and business leaders to help them make smarter and faster decisions. No other company in the world provides the same holistic investment offering: our superpower is the combination of human insights and unique investor-led content with a global expert network. We serve over 1,000 investment firms, offering clients 24/7 coverage through our team of 1,300+ employees located across eight offices.

Job Description

Third Bridge’s Discovery is dedicated to producing and developing innovative products to address our clients' needs. We capture, map and distribute knowledge to assist our clients with their research.
The Analyst position is a key enabler in the creation of the Third Bridge Maps product, covering North American and European business entities.
Reporting to Manager - Discovery, you will interact daily with our specialist community. As specialists are a shared resource, you will also frequently interact with Forum and Connections internal stakeholders who will benefit from the output generated. Finally, as we are working in an agile way, you will be closely involved in business, product, data and development initiatives and will work closely with our internal product, tech and data consolidation teams.
Responsibilities
Your main responsibilities will be to engage with our specialist community and use our data capture tools to create maps of our specialists’ expertise. In doing so, you will assist in improving our operational processes and providing continuous feedback on our data capture and visualisation tools. You will also contribute to defining the rollout and automation strategy of our approach.
A successful candidate will have
Excellent interpersonal and strong communication skills with proven experience in communicating effectively and building relationships quickly over the phone
Critical, analytical and creative thinking skills, with the ability to detect areas for improvement and suggest innovative solutions
Proven ability to work under pressure and at a fast pace
Confidence in working autonomously and a strong work ethic to be able to work well in uncertainty
A strong interest in financial markets, research and understanding of how different businesses or industries work
Sector expertise in either Consumer, Healthcare, TMT, Industrials Materials and Energy, Financials, or interest to develop specific expertise is a plus

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree
1-3 years of experience, preferably in the financial services industry
Previously worked in Sales or high paced target driven environment
Education or work experience directly related to commercial due diligence process would be a plus, examples - Investment Banking, Consulting and Business Journalism
Excellent interpersonal and strong communication skills with proven experience in communicating effectively and building relationships quickly over the phone
Fluent English Speaker
You should be currently based in Mumbai

Additional Information

Why work for us?
Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a competitive salary reflective of your skills and experience.
Time Off: Benefit from 18 days of paid time off (PTO), 8 fixed holidays, 1 floating holiday, and 8 casual leaves. PTO increases with tenure.
Learning & Development: Receive a personal development reimbursment yearly for customized learning programs. Additionally, a dedicated budget supports studies and job-related qualifications.
Health & Well-being: Access private medical insurance, maternity benefits, and engage in various events promoting mental health.
Life Cover: Automatically enrolled in Life Insurance cover from your date of hire, providing coverage 4x the annual CTC.
Flexibility: Embrace our work-from-anywhere policy, hybrid work options, and enjoy "Winter Fridays."
Fun at Work: Unwind in our breakout area with games like foosball, Table Tennis, and PlayStation5.
Recognition & Rewards: Earn points through our colleague-to-colleague recognition program, redeemable for hotels, gift cards, charity donations, and more.
Snacks & Refreshments: Stay energized with daily snacks, tea, and coffee provided.
CSR Days: Contribute to social responsibility with 2 CSR days annually – take time off to volunteer.
Equal Opportunity Employer: Third Bridge is proud to foster diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected under local laws.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines
The successful candidate must, by the start of the employment, have permission to work in the country they are applying.
We know that to be truly innovative, we need to have a diverse team around us. That is why Third Bridge is committed to creating an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. If you are not 100% sure if you are right for the role, please apply anyway and we will be happy to consider your application.

Main function of job:

You will be responsible for day-to-day supervision of the Finance Operational Insight Team along with providing, forward thinking, key business intelligence and management information to aid improved decision making and drive improved performance across the Group.

Support finance divisional representatives to improve the understanding of financial performance across all fee earning and leadership roles.

You will also be responsible for maintaining the financial performance application suite and relevant reporting (MyFinancials/Qlikview) for the Group and collaborating with the IT Applications Development team to ensure the service is operational and provides accurate and relevant information on a timely basis for the fee earners and wider business to deliver against targets.

Main Duties:
Supervise and work within a high performing Operational Insight Team with a strong focus on high quality data driven insight and performance analysis
Support the Operational Insight Manager, Director of Operations and Finance Leadership teams with powerful business intelligence on a timely basis to aid good quality decision making
Review and governance of operational finance and divisional policies such as time recording, rates and client lifecycle.
Review and ensure the information provided by the team is of impeccable quality, is user friendly and, where relevant, provide further operational insight and commentary on key themes and trends, making appropriate forward-thinking recommendations
Support the Operational Insight Manager in identifying, defining and developing the necessary operating KPIs to enable the function to operate successfully
Provide detailed analysis and insight into industry and client trends, ensuring we fully support the Executive Board and Divisional leadership teams to drive increased performance in every area
To monitor the deliverables and objectives of the team ensuring that the focus is informed by the wider finance operations strategy
Encourage knowledge sharing across the operations functions and lead by example to ensure direct reports mirror collaboration with their peers and colleagues
To positively lead the team, taking appropriate action to ensure the team objectives are on track and that mitigating actions are taken where appropriate and relevant
Provide training and development of teams to enable continuous improvement and engagement of our people
Maintain a high performance culture ensuring that objective setting cascades to the function and that the teams have a clear understanding of how they contribute to the Finance and business strategy
To performance manage direct reports through the use of DWF performance management frameworks to drive performance and address / resolve underperformance in a positive manner

The above is not an exhaustive list of duties and you will be expected to perform different tasks as necessitated by your changing role within the organisation and the overall business objectives of the organisation

Key Skills:
Significant job experience and knowledge of financial related processes and performance in reporting, financial performance and operational delivery
Experience of working in a matrix organisation and delivering results in a global business
Experience working in a customer orientated organisation and track record of delivering high levels of performance to both internal and external stakeholders
Experience leading and implementing change
Strong communication and relationship management skills
Highly organised with the ability to learn quickly and work independently
Hardworking, dedicated and with a passion for success
Experience of holding self and others accountable for the achievement of performance expectations
Create and foster an environment of delivering results and driving performance
Strong communication skills and the ability to summarise technical information effectively for a wide range of audiences both within and outside of the Finance function
Excellent problem-solving skills and proven track record in making recommendations that consider a broad range of factors to aid the delivery of strategic project
Professional services sector understanding and business knowledge
Ability to supervise a technical team along with effective delegation and prioritisation of competing workloads
Excellent Data Management and Data Analysis skills
Excellent IT skills, including Microsoft Excel, SQL and Qlikview
A High-level of attention to detail with a significant emphasis on quality of work and a stakeholder centric mind-set
A self-starter with the ability to work autonomously and pro-actively and remain focused on core priorities in a fast paced and changing environment to support the team in delivering results.

titles: Senior Data Analyst (Asst. Manager)- Global Sourcing & Procurement
descriptions:
Flexible Work Eligible: None
DISCOVER your opportunity

Data Analyst - Global Sourcing & Procurement
Senior Data Analyst (Asst. Manager)- Global Sourcing & Procurement-
Gurgaon, Haryana, India
The GSP (Global Sourcing & Procurement) team supports the AXA XL Operations by providing sourcing and Procurement services to the whole AXA XL organization (65 entities 25 countries). GSP is currently on an important transformation journey aiming to put in place all the key Procurement processes & tools to cover all the value chain of GSP, such as P2P (Procurement to pay, Contract management (Contract In), Vendor management, spend management… In that context, we are looking for a Data analyst. The role will be strategic in the GSP organization.

DISCOVER your opportunity
What will your essential responsibilities include?
Relevant experience in the field of Business Intelligence. Expérience with the Power BI tool is a must.

Proficient with Power BI development, deployment & Maintenance.

Expert in transforming data using tools like Excel, Python, and SQL.

Proficiency with Excel is a must.

Well versed with DBMS concepts – Star/snowflake schema, Data Modeling.

Understanding ELT tools like Azure, and Alteryx will be an added advantage.

Familiarity with some of the applications like Coupa, SAP, and Salesforce.

Understanding of Data Science Concepts like SARIMA, Regression, and PCA.

Power Automation and SharePoint development experience will be a plus.

You will report to the Analytics & Reporting Lead, Sr. Manager
SHARE your talent

SHARE your talent
We’re looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:
Required Skills and Abilities:
Effective problem-solving ability:
o Ability to structure a problem statement and propose a path to resolve.
o Generate insights from the data.
o Proactively anticipate typical data quality / ‘usability’ issues (e.g., exhaustiveness of the data, comparability of periods/scopes, currency conversion…).

Good understanding of financial / budgeting/procurement process and data types/requirements (e.g., general ledger accounts, transaction-level data of different types, and categories…).

Good ability to synthesize / package data insights to facilitate easier communication with stakeholders and support decision-making.

Desired Skills and Abilities:
Autonomous, self-driving, follows-up.

Good ability to work plan and ability to meet deadlines / manage time effectively.

Ability to engage effectively with a range of stakeholders up to mid-managerial level (e.g. finance, budget owner delegates, category managers).

Ability to adapt priorities dynamically depending on business/stakeholder demands and urgency.

Good understanding of all Procurement processes (sourcing, contracting, Vendor Management…).

Complex problem-solving capabilities.

Excellent English written/verbal skillset for business communications/meetings with internal/external stakeholders.

FIND your future
AXA XL, the P&C and speciality risk division of AXA, is known for solving complex risks. For mid-sized companies, multinationals and even some inspirational individuals we don’t just provide re/insurance, we reinvent it.

How? By combining a comprehensive and efficient capital platform, data-driven insights, leading technology, and the best talent in an agile and inclusive workspace, empowered to deliver top client service across all our lines of business property, casualty, professional, financial lines and speciality.

With an innovative and flexible approach to risk solutions, we partner with those who move the world forward.

Learn more at axaxl.com

Inclusion & Diversity
AXA XL is committed to equal employment opportunity and will consider applicants regardless of gender, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity and origins, marital status, religion, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

At AXA XL, we know that an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce enable business growth and are critical to our success. That’s why we have made a strategic commitment to attract, develop, advance and retain the most diverse workforce possible, and create an inclusive culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and can reach their highest potential. It’s about helping one another — and our business — to move forward and succeed.

Five Business Resource Groups focused on gender, LGBTQ+, ethnicity and origins, disability and inclusion with 20 Chapters around the globe.
Robust support for Flexible Working Arrangements
Enhanced family-friendly leave benefits
Named to the Diversity Best Practices Index
Signatory to the UK Women in Finance Charter

Learn more at axaxl.com/about-us/inclusion-and-diversity. AXA XL is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Sustainability

At AXA XL, Sustainability is integral to our business strategy. In an ever-changing world, AXA XL protects what matters most for our clients and communities. We know that sustainability is at the root of a more resilient future. Our 2023-26 Sustainability strategy, called “Roots of resilience”, focuses on protecting natural ecosystems, addressing climate change, and embedding sustainable practices across our operations.

Our Pillars:
Valuing nature: How we impact nature affects how nature impacts us. Resilient ecosystems - the foundation of a sustainable planet and society – are essential to our future. We’re committed to protecting and restoring nature – from mangrove forests to the bees in our backyard – by increasing biodiversity awareness and inspiring clients and colleagues to put nature at the heart of their plans.
Addressing climate change: The effects of a changing climate are far-reaching and significant. Unpredictable weather, increasing temperatures, and rising sea levels cause both social inequalities and environmental disruption. We're building a net zero strategy, developing insurance products and services, and mobilizing to advance thought leadership and investment in societal-led solutions.
Integrating ESG: All companies have a role to play in building a more resilient future. Incorporating ESG considerations into our internal processes and practices builds resilience from the roots of our business. We’re training our colleagues, engaging our external partners, and evolving our sustainability governance and reporting.
AXA Hearts in Action: We have established volunteering and charitable giving programs to help colleagues support causes that matter most to them, known as AXA XL’s “Hearts in Action” programs. These include our Matching Gifts program, Volunteering Leave, and our annual volunteering day – the Global Day of Giving.

For more information, please see axaxl.com/sustainability.

AXA XL is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

As a member of the IDE – ERP Capability Center at Shell, you will have the opportunity to work in a challenging but rewarding environment that is fast paced and changing fundamentally as Shell transforms its business to meet the ambition to be a net-zero emissions energy business by 2050, whilst delivering a world class business case that has a strong societal license to operate. In your IDE-ERP career at Shell you will be expected to enact change and deliver value globally across business lines and geographies.
What’s the role
Experience in delivering complete SAP Profitability and Performance Management (SAP PaPM) solutions to the business, proficient in analyzing and translating Business/Process requirements to technical requirements
Certain degree of knowledge in S4 HANA Controlling and other modules is desired

Understanding of Business requirements and develop the IT Solution by working along with Process Architects/Design Authorities
